@slay_suwei We agree that nobody is deserving of a wild card. We just disagree on the wild cards being used specifically for young local talent. Lots of people hold that view I just donâ€™t think thatâ€™s fair on all the players out there who donâ€™t come from countries that host tour level events
@slay_suwei Yes British players benefit a lot from wild cards. As do Spanish players. And I donâ€™t believe that is fair.
@slay_suwei The original tweet had other players Twitter handles attached and I was not arguing with what they said as I donâ€™t speak Spanish!

@slay_suwei Nobody is saying itâ€™s crazy and youâ€™re entitled to that opinion. Many players donâ€™t come from countries that happen to host big tennis tournaments. Isnâ€™t that very unfair that those players wonâ€™t get any wild cards?

@mandonesh1 It was incredibly special. My point is that nobody â€˜deservesâ€™ wild cards. Me included. Just because you come from a country that happens to host major tennis events or are signed to a management company that runs tennis events you arenâ€™t more deserving than anyone else.

@slay_suwei Any tournament can give their wild cards to whoever they want. But just because Iâ€™m British shouldnâ€™t make me more â€˜deservingâ€™ of a wild card than anyone else for Wimbledon. Holger Rune is less deserving than a local Spanish player?
